Problem:
Consider a system governed by the Laplace Transform \\( \\mathcal{L}\{f(t)\} = F(s) \\). We examine the effects of the convolution operation using a kernel \\( k(t) \\) with its transform \\( K(s) \\), on the system function \\( f(t) \\).

If the convolution \\( (f*k)(t) \\) is applied initially and the result evolves naturally, will the output at time t = T be the same as if \\( f(t) \\) alone was evolved without convolution up to t = T?
Explanation: The convolution modifies the input by integrating the effects of \\( k(t) \\) over \\( f(t) \\), altering the initial state and thus the system's response at any future time T differently than if unaltered \\( f(t) \\) were evolved.
